data.author: Mike Prorock

changelog.release_notes: added caching for weather and a few other improvements
Updated an issue with fetching weather due to changes on the open weather api
Fixed a minor issue with weather not being always set.
Updated several misc internal code items.  Disabled debugging output codes.  Disabled some vibrartions during quiet time.
cleaned up some code and resources to decrease footprint.  bt/battery text will go red in warning states.
Fixed a small memory leak related to font unloading
Another minor update restructuring code for an optimal config.  Also set compass to toggle on shake rather than just relying on a timeout to switch back off.
Some updates in preparation for configuration
Initial build.  Largely optimized around battery life and minimal resource utilization.

data.description: WatchInfo is a lightweight, text based watch face that displays key information at a glance.  Time (of course), date, compass heading and direction, weather, location, and battery/bluetooth status.  This was developed to scratch an itch for an all purpose, low battery drain watch face for hiking, camping, and all around usage.  No configuration for now, though that is likely to change.  Tap/Shake will enable compass, which will then go back to sleep when activity is not detected.  Between 10pm and 6am, a low power mode is engaged, stopping the second blink, and requiring a triple tap or vigorous shake to re-enable the compass.  Weather is synced on the hour.
data.title: WatchInfo
